peopleAlsoAsk.question: How do I know if my German beer stein is valuable?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Once you've verified the authenticity of your German Beer Stein, the value of the piece will depend on its rarity and age. Naturally, the older and rarer your stein, the more valuable. Authentic German Beer Steins are categorized into five eras. Early beer steins were made between the 16th and early 19th centuries.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Hidden Treasure: How Much is Your German Beer Stein Worth?

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How can you tell how old a beer stein is?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Pewter lids and their shapes play a significant role in determining stein age. Most old pewter lids are of medium to heavy weight pewter, not inexpensive for their time, in shapes more elaborate than today's (although even 100 years ago one could order the cheaper steins with thin, flimsy pewter covers).

peopleAlsoAsk.question: What are the different types of German beer steins?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet:
TYPES OF GERMAN BEER STEINS
Ceramic Beer Steins. Ceramic beer steins are made from various earth materials to form a mug that holds either half a litre or one whole litre of beer. The designs are often based on the antique originals of the past. ...
Pewter Beer Steins.
Crystal Beer Steins.

peopleAlsoAsk.question: Why are steins expensive?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Made of high-quality materials. Genuine German beer mugs are often expensive and bulky because they are made with costly materials such as silver, pewter, wood, glass, etc. A stein made of an expensive or rare material can give further context to why a stein might have a higher value.
